bug.author: anupash147
bug.summary: Jupyter notebook gives "Error during WebSocket handshake: Unexpected response code: 504"
bug.description: /kind bug I have implemented kubeflow in aws using <denchmark-link:https://deploy-preview-977--competent-brattain-de2d6d.netlify.com/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/>https://deploy-preview-977--competent-brattain-de2d6d.netlify.com/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/</denchmark-link> . Also configured my dex auth with my company policy. I am able to setup the multiuser environment. But when i succeed creating the jupyter server and start using the server the notebook never connects. On inspect i get error : Error during WebSocket handshake: Unexpected response code: 504 Nothing in the logs of container. [W 04:19:07.074 NotebookApp] Replacing stale connection: b94f2038-4331-4499-93b9-25932db96ff0:3fd26c97100c435d90e8ecd0737436b7 [W 04:21:11.891 NotebookApp] Replacing stale connection: b94f2038-4331-4499-93b9-25932db96ff0:3fd26c97100c435d90e8ecd0737436b7 How do i debug or fix it. My Kubeflow version 0.6.0-rc2 running on kubenetes 0.14 deployed over ec2 machines using kops. Screenshot : <denchmark-link:https://15905978862850875460.googlegroups.com/attach/f7afed2c6d72/Screen%20Shot%202019-08-31%20at%202.47.18%20PM.png?part=0.1&view=1&vt=ANaJVrFetsB8H7xKMriHhK3Jjud_o2K0KRovfUle6FuOHsurGeZ9iFyfHUkNehue5krB6ZE95MdFEfmDKorjh6ADXOLUByow6z4pLB34xvXR56sYXEI_16A>https://15905978862850875460.googlegroups.com/attach/f7afed2c6d72/Screen%20Shot%202019-08-31%20at%202.47.18%20PM.png?part=0.1&view=1&vt=ANaJVrFetsB8H7xKMriHhK3Jjud_o2K0KRovfUle6FuOHsurGeZ9iFyfHUkNehue5krB6ZE95MdFEfmDKorjh6ADXOLUByow6z4pLB34xvXR56sYXEI_16A</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.74. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

Could this be an issue with the LoadBalancer or Ingress not being configured to use websockets. e.g: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/pull/347>kubeflow/manifests#347</denchmark-link>
/cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kunmingg>@kunmingg</denchmark-link>

Thanks fo the response <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> , I am using the istio gateway, and i tried adding upgradewebsocket : true ref : <denchmark-link:https://github.com/istio/istio/issues/9152>istio/istio#9152</denchmark-link> but it does not still seems to work. I still get the 504.. In work i editted the virtualservice that defines the routing to the gateway. Let me know if you need more information?
Another related issue looks pretty much the same : <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/1344>#1344</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link>
Shouldn't be related unless ambassador is being used. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/anupash147>@anupash147</denchmark-link>
How did you configure dex?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kunmingg>@kunmingg</denchmark-link> : we configured kubeflow to the OIDC protocol.

Hi, Iam running into an similar issue (though not using dex) on AWS. Protocol used for the ingress is TCP so I was hoping websockets would work out of the box. It works fine when using port-forwarding: kubectl port-forward -n istio-system svc/istio-ingressgateway 8080:80 Best, FB
True, i also saw this issue when i enabled https over the gateway. This is when i was testing without istio enabled.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/anupash147>@anupash147</denchmark-link> If you are using EC2 did you try following the AWS directions? /cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/anupash147>@anupash147</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/fabianbaier>@fabianbaier</denchmark-link> please describe the complete path for a request? I believe at every hop there's a potential for something to go wrong. If it works when you port-forward to the ISTIO gateway e.g. <denchmark-code>kubectl port-forward -n istio-system svc/istio-ingressgateway 8080:80 </denchmark-code>
Then this suggests the problem is upstream of Kubeflow. So it is most likely a configuration problem in the load-balancer (or whatever network stack you are using) to direct traffic to the ISTIO gateway.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link>
I think you're right. This was most likely a problem with the load-balancer per se. I noticed when re-deploying it worked fine. Now that said I can't replicate the problem so I really hope it was a one time thing. I am sure to update you here if I run into this again. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/anupash147>@anupash147</denchmark-link>
So the idea behind this is to see if websockets via https work in general and then trying to identify the culprit from there? E.g. in this case if this portforwarding would work, looking as a next step at the LoadBalancer and if something goes there wrong with https?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/fabianbaier>@fabianbaier</denchmark-link> : i found 2 problems, my gateway is deployed in istio-system, but the notebook server creates with gateway pointing to kubeflow (this is default in the the manifest). Also the host reflects it to '*'. NAME GATEWAYS HOSTS AGE notebook-ax-test2 [kubeflow/kubeflow-gateway] [*] 5d8h To prove this point i duplicated the virtualservice as editing on the fly / replacing is not helping. So i created a virtualservice by name notebook-ax-test2-tst, and it worked. NAME GATEWAYS HOSTS AGE notebook-ax-t2 [kubeflow/kubeflow-gateway] [*] 64m notebook-ax-t2-tst [istio-system/kubeflow-gateway] [kf.xx.organization.com] 3s I would request the GODS of this pull request to help me <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3104>#3104</denchmark-link> (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/lluunn>@lluunn</denchmark-link> ) I am still digging on the 504 issue

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/fabianbaier>@fabianbaier</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> : here is my loadbalancer annotation <denchmark-code>apiVersion: v1 kind: Service metadata: annotations: beta.cloud.google.com/backend-config: '{"ports": {"http2":"iap-backendconfig"}}' service.beta.kubernetes.io/aws-load-balancer-backend-protocol: http service.beta.kubernetes.io/aws-load-balancer-connection-idle-timeout: "60" service.beta.kubernetes.io/aws-load-balancer-ssl-cert: <redacted> service.beta.kubernetes.io/aws-load-balancer-ssl-ports: '*' </denchmark-code>
applied to the istio-ingressgateway. I also tried changing my timeout to 600 but it does not work either. I am lost
